attributes.action: Prevent overproduction of meat under the DEFRA excemption on religious slaughter
attributes.additional_details: As there is no legislation requiring religiously slaughtered meat to be labelled consumers are denied choice to not buy/ eat these products.
attributes.background: Under DEFRA guidelines the excemption for religious slaughter is for those groups that require it.  This is being either abused or not enforced. This results in groups that do not require them receiving products which are against their ethical /religious needs which may be against their human rights

rejection.details:
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

You might like to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/200147
